Reviews.Title: “Great People”
Reviews.Author: Ehtesham123
Reviews.Content: Apart from the location which was very near to the tourist attractions and on top of it close the tram that gives you the access to virtually the whole of Istanbul. The people at the hotel were nice with a great deal of knowledge of the available attractions that makes it easy to decide on where actually to wander about. All in all a brilliant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: ssprashanth
Reviews.Content: Its one of those better than the rest of the bouquet hotels centrally located, though the neighbourhood may be crowded (narrow lanes etc). Don't expect the hotel to be a la holiday inn, radisson etc but its definitely one of those budget hotels that may fit ur purse with better bargains depending on the length of ur stay. Service was very good. The hotel might be a bit rigid if u have to extend ur check out time by a couple of hours beyond their standard check out time of 12 noon.

Reviews.Title: “Central and nice”
Reviews.Author: AftabandAnnie
Reviews.Content: The location was excellent and so was all the staff especially the manager Hakan. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We went as a family group of six and we got 2 triple sleeper bedrooms next to each other which was very good. the bedsheets and towels were changed daily and the room and bathroom cleaned daily- the hotel maid was very helpful tidying our rooms . The views from the breakfast room of the sea and the Blue mosque were fantastic. The Blue Mosque, Hippodrome and Hagia Sophia were less than 5-10 minutes walk from the hotel. The supermarket is right opposite the hotel, which is ideal and convienent. Recommended location for family and couples.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nancyqu
Reviews.Content: It was our first visit to Turkey. We stayed at the Legend hotel. Best of all was the very friendly service and advice to all the questions we had. Breakfast is complete and a lot better than the standard Turkish 4-star hotel. The room was always very clean and well warmed up during the cold days in February. The location of the hotel is very central. Most places of interest are within walking distance. Its only a two minute walk to the tramway stop to get connection to distant places. We can advise this hotel to all people who are looking for a clean, well managed, central located, reasonably priced hotel with very kind staff giving good advice for all activities. I will definatly come back to this hotel.. Thanks very much to the owner Jack...

Reviews.Title: “"old world charm".....”
Reviews.Author: irish-mumbai
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from Mumbai after cancelling the other one provided by our tour agent: since the reviews I read for the hotel forced me to do so. We checked in on 16 Feb evening, traveling with 4 friends, as soon as we reached Ali greeted us with a big smile and got the luggage transferred. we booked one twin and a triple, but couldn't find a triple as we learnt they have same size room available ie; a double bed and a single, room size just ok, ne ways we managed. Next morning made our stay memorable as it started snowing, wonderful atmosphere, great views from roof top. All sights Blue mosque, Hagia sophia, Topkapi palace , cistern, within walking reach.The hotel reminds and give us a charm of an old world, best location in Sultanahmet.Free wi-fi really helped staying connected. But one regret about breakfast, nor continental, American or Indian, only salads, bread and cheese might be turkish. On our request they made us omlettes which we relished on.. Ali and Alp is 24/7 front of the desk for guidance, may it be for a mobile simcard, night club ,a restaurant or sight seeing... Overall I would not mind staying here again...

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mikeconpop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. We got the nice room and was really pleased with it. Being winter and some bad weather, we had to plan our day to make the most of our trip. The staff at the front desk was extremely helpful. They helped us plan according to the weather forecast. They recommended us good restaurants to go to and where to get stuff, etc. The hotel is within walking distance to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Topkapi Palace, Underground cistern, Grand Bazaar, etc. There are good and affordable restaurants nearby. Just ask them. Free wifi troughout the hotel. Free breakfast and free transportation to and from the airport was included in our package.I highly recomend this hotel. Thanx to the owners (Jack&Kubi)...

Reviews.Title: “awesome place to stay”
Reviews.Author: istanbul187147
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in Istanbul in January and this hotel is a great place to stay and enjoy the city in a comfortable room, staff is very helpful and always smiling, the services (breakfast, lunch, dinner...) are also very good and with a large variety offered, i really recommand this place

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected quality!!”
Reviews.Author: George T
Reviews.Content: I just found this place via an agency at the airport and i'm glad i did! The breakfast room was so nice, also my room(which was 105) was also really good & comfy... This place has a great view from the terrace plus so close to everywhere, it's like in the middle of everything and the staff was really good, specially Alp was very helpful with his tips & recommendations. So the bottom line is, it was really good to stay here...

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, even greater service!”
Reviews.Author: juanatere
Reviews.Content: This place is wonderful. The rooms are clean and adequately spacious. Their best feature though is their extraordinary service. We just walked in off the street, and from the moment we said we needed a room could not have been better taken care of. There REALLY is somebody at the front desk 24/7. The breakfast is fresh and on a terrace overlooking the water. Hakan took great care of all of our requests down from organizing outings to hand delivering messages and did it with a smile. The hotel is very close (within a short walking distance) to all the sights but off the main drag so it isn't noisy. I would recommend this place to everybody. Thank you Hakan for taking such good care of us.

Reviews.Title: “Best service for the price”
Reviews.Author: Adnan K
Reviews.Content: I showed up late night for the first time in Istanbul. When I asked the front desk guy if there is any hammam around, he gave me a guy to walk me to a closest hammam knowing this is my first time in Istanbul. And the service was free. I was impressed by their customer service. The guy at the front desk (Alp if I'm not mistaken the name) was very helpful and provided me with the local tourist information, etc. He was more than just a front desk guy. They have good resources and very friendly and honest people. If you are going to Istanbul for the first time, with a fixed budget but want a good comfort and trust worthy place, this is a great hotel to stay. Breakfast is served on the top floor with a view of the water and the city. I even took up coffee to the roof top and it was all by myself. I'm very happy with this hotel and service and I would go there next time. Kids friendly , more of a family place. A.K (Toronto)

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: rayandmay
Reviews.Content: A truly great place to stay.I have stayed in many hotels over numerous years and have rarely come across a more welcoming hotel.The staff are extremely friendly and helpful and always willing to chat to you about anything.In addition, the free breakfast was excellent and the service faultless. Finally, the hotel is exceptional value for money as it is in the heart of the cities main attractions.. I highly recommend this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: Abdel A
Reviews.Content: The location is too close to the sultanahmed blue Mosuque, grand bazaar. Accessibility to this hotel is excelent since it is only 5 mins away from the tramway and the metro. The rooms are comfortable with a plenty of space to stretch out and enjoy yourself. Everyone at Legend Hotels went out of their way to ensure our stay in the city was enjoyable. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and will definitely stay there again when I (hopefully) return to Istanbul. All staff were very helpful, polite and in general very professional.Haka Hunkar, the front office manager was so nice and helpful. this hotel is Highly recommend to anyone travelling to Istanbul. I booked from the Airport and were also offered a complimentary pick up from and to Ataturk Airport. So many thanx to Vedat from the front desk..

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: jeanchris
Reviews.Content: Was a very good hotel - the staf are very good-very helpful and take care of you - I was a woman on her own and they did look after me - the only criticizem I would have is the rooms are a little warm - but December in Istanbul that is not too much of a problem - Thank you x I

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: josh t
Reviews.Content: Small hotel with very friendly staff. The manager Tuncay and front desk staff spoke excellent English and helped arrange guided tours for my friends, but also were always willing to offer advice and conversation where no service was involved. Food served at the restaurant is simple and well prepared and they have a fully stocked bar in a very homey front lobby. Restaurant and rooftop offer GORGEOUS views of the Blue Mosque and the ocean. The Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia are 15 minute walks away, and the tram stops about 5 minute walk. Many fine restaurants in the area and walkable to Grand Bazaar. Only downside is rooms are generally small and short on amenities. Highly recommend for those who prefer a quiet and friendly place to crash after a day's exploration, not for those who wish for golden pillows and big TV's :)

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Kind”
Reviews.Author: Magyariska
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well placed and a short walk to all the main attractions of sultanhamet,close to the tram line and a large selection of restaurants. The room was a reasonable size,clean and comfortable. The staff were extremely helpful and nothing was too much trouble.Boss and Vedat in reception are very nice.The view from the roof terrace was spectacular. I would strongly recommend this hotel as a base for exploring Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: MajorSCL
Reviews.Content: I booked the Legend Hotel as a surprise holiday for my husband, and we had a fabulous stay. We stayed in the sea view room which had contemporary design, with beautiful chaise longue and plenty of space for our shopping bags..The hotel just has a nice "small hotel" boutique feel, where you are made feel welcome and at home. Rooftop area also very nice.Handy location, nice stroll to restaurants, Grand Bazaar, Blue mosque etc.. Staff are fantastic and friendly.We provided by Vedat and the whole team......you may stay in more palatial and far more expensive hotels but you will never receive better service than that provided here.I would highly recommend this hotel to all types of traveller..

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ringomania
Reviews.Content: The location is ideal close to the sultanahmed, grand bazaar and sights. Accessible since it is streets away from the tramway and the metro. The rooms are extremely comfortable with a relaxed, chilled out style to them. The best part is the size of the rooms, plenty of space to stretch out and enjoy yourself.Everyone at Legend Hotels went out of their way to ensure our stay in the city was enjoyable. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience and will definitely stay there again when I (hopefully) return to Istanbul. So many thanx to Vedat from the front desk..

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, close to attractions, but not luxurious at all”
Reviews.Author: Sanne T
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a week in June 2011. The hotel was very well located - only 3 mins walk to Grand Bazar, Sultan Ahmet and many other attractions. The breakfast was borring and we ate the same thing almost every day. Even the music was from the same Celine Dion cd all week. The staff were friendly and welcoming, and we didn't experience any problems. The room was really small, dark and not cosy at all, but we had a great view. The bathroom and shower were small but thats quite normal for a 3 stars hotel. We only stayed in the hotel when we wanted to rest and sleep and for that purpose the hotel was ok. This is not a hotel to chose if you want to stay in the hotel for many hours - except if you chose the more expensive rooms. We were awaken by the birds who ran over our bathroom roof very early in the morning. Television is outdated. The wifi connection was great on all floors. The hotel has a beautiful garden and outdoor terrace. The aircondition worked fine. All in all this hotel had some good things and some bad. We would probably think twice about living in this hotel again cause we may need a bit more luxury on our vacation than we got during our stay. But we didn't regret our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: asperjoh
Reviews.Content: Recently I spent 7 days at the Legend Hotel Sultanahmet, Istanbul. The location was exceptional - walking distance to all key attractions eg Blue Mosque, Agia Sophia,Topkapi Palace.The Hotel room was excellent - clean and well presented. All staff were very helpful, polite and in general very professional.Vedat from the reception was so nice and helpful. Highly recommend anyone travelling to Istanbul to consider this hotel. We booked on line and were also offered a complimentary pick up from Ataturk Airport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place & Good food”
Reviews.Author: moncarsoko
Reviews.Content: Legend Hotel is located near Sultanahmet , within walking distance, once a private mansion has a great history. It is a small boutique hotel with the best staff and service I've encountered in my travels. The grounds are well maintained.The rooms are clean and well decorated and includes a mini fridge. The beds the most comfortable.The delicious open buffet breakfast was included in the room rate and was more than adequate to start your day. What a beautiful spread! The hotel is also within walking distance of a few outdoor Grand Bazaar and local restaurants. Staff are very friendly, especially Vedat from the front desk answered every single questions.He was very helpfull. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lecherous waiter...”
Reviews.Author: 2Echo
Reviews.Content: The room I had was facing the noisy street. Terrible lighting and very outdated decor and furniture. Breakfast was average, not always fresh, squash rather than juice. Only tea was available and I overheard a waiter telling a guest that there was an extra charge for coffee. I was surprised while eating dinner when a guest came and asked our waiter for a massage in her room, he agreed. He returned after about 20 minutes rolling up his sleeves and smiling. I couldn't believe how indiscrete he was. I wasn't impressed by his table service either, especially the fact that I asked for white wine but he forced my friend and I to drink a 'special' bottle of red. It's fortunate that I drink red, otherwise I'd have refused it. For the duration of my stay, the waiter frequently knocked on my door reminding me I could go up to the terrace. On one occasion he appeared to be drunk and was rather aggressive. His behaviour was very unprofessional. Maybe some women are happy with a 'quickie' from a waiter but not all women have the same view. For the sake of any lone female travellers out there, his name is Tunjay... Be aware or don't go there. The pros? Good location within walking distance of many landmarks such as: Blue Mosque, Hagia sofia, hamam etc.

Reviews.Title: “hope to come back asap!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marios_Backpacker
Reviews.Content: one of the best places we've ever stayed, great location and staff. specially that young receptionist(name was alp) has been very helpful and nice to us. u wanna stay in a good place in this city, this is it ;)

Reviews.Title: “The view of the sea from the terrace is the best!!”
Reviews.Author: taiiz
Reviews.Content: I feel really good with a terrace of the top floor eating breakfast. It was a small hotel, but a location was very good. We can walk to Blue Mosque and the grand bazaar.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good stay.. a value for money hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Spellbinder13
Reviews.Content: The location of the legend hotel is conveniently close to the grand bazaar.. and the view from its restaurant too is amazing... but yes u have to be careful in choosing ur rooms and if u can manage to get one of the rooms with a good view ur stay will be amazing... nice hotel n good staff...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull Place,Lovely Staff ...”
Reviews.Author: Domentogino
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for three wonderful nights in May. We arrived early one morning feeling extremely tired after travelling for long hours. The staff at reception welcomed us warmly, and quickly organised refreshing tea in the lovely waiting area. I chose the Legend Hotel because of its reviews on TripAdvisor and was not disappointed. A truly elegant small hotel in a fantastic location - just a short walk to the tourist spots, and the tram is only a short distance away to take you to the other sites. We really enjoyed our stay here in a superior room. Walking distance to many of the "must see" sites. Staff was very helpful. Rooftop terrace was fantastic (the evening call to prayers is spine-tingling up there). Free WiFi.. I also want to thank to Batman ( His real name is Batman) for everything.. I will definatly come back and stay at Legend Hotel again....

Reviews.Title: “Recommended for great location and great service”
Reviews.Author: OrchardB
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a week at the Legend, booked 'blind' with no previous knowledge of Istanbul: just a desire to experience some of the history and culture and see the Turkish F1 Grand Prix! Firstly - location - as has been said before- is perfect for the 'historic' part of the city :all main attractions in easy walking distance, as is the tram stop that will take you to Taksim and other areas of interest. It's in the heart of a bustling village really - although far enough away to avoid some of the noise. Service: we managed to leave a piece of our hand luggage in the taxi on arrival. They were on the phone immediately, sorting it out for us - then gave us tea while we waited for its return! Hasan is multi-lingual and very knowledgable and will help you to find your way around and avoid problems. We could not have asked for more helpful staff, all round. If you want 5 star luxury - this is not the place for you. It's getting on a bit, but we had comfortable beds and a modern TV - so if you want value for money, friendly staff and a terrific location for the old city, this comes highly recommended. Oh - and free wifi too - very much appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Not So Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: NextStop1982
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Legend for 8 days in April, the location of the hotel cannot be beat. You are a 5 min walk from the Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Museums, Tramline, etc. The views from the upper floors, rooftop terrace and breakfast room are amazing. The hotel it self is very old and in desperate need of a renovation. Our tiny room had a lumpy bed, a ceiling that was peeling, a bathroom with a running toilet and broken shower door, and a tiny 13 inch television that barely worked. If you want a cheap hotel in a great location this is it, but dont expect much else i'd give it a 2 out of 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good staff bad management”
Reviews.Author: USTraveler60763
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this hotel. Our first night, we were given a terrible room, the carpet was dirty, room extremely small, could not move around nor use our luggage; I would not have my dog sleep in such a room. I complained to the general manager, his name is Hakan, and he did not do anything about it. My first mission the next morning was to check out and find another hotel, but one of the guests at breakfast told me that this guy is not helpful and I should contact someone else when Hakan is not working. I did talk to the other manager, and we were moved to another room, which was much better. All the other staff, except for Hakan, are nice, very friendly and helpful. they tried to do what they can to make our stay comfortable, but the problem is that the hotel is not well maintained, our shower door was broken and we complained but they could not fix it. the hotel needs major renovations, everything is old and falling apart. It's too bad, since the location is prime, but you have to worry about one thing after another falling apart in the room.

Reviews.Title: “BEST location, great service, comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: khismet
Reviews.Content: You really can't beat the location. All the main sights are within a 5 minute walk, but it's not on a busy or noisy street. You can get a great view of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop and there are nice views of the Sea of Marmara from the breakfast room. Breakfast is delicious: cucumbers, tomato, yogurt, hard-boiled eggs, fruit, bread, cereal, tea, coffee, juice. Rooms are clean and comfy. The service is excellent and friendly. The doors are opened and the elevator called before you even think about it. Cengiz (pronounced Jengus) was particularly helpful and attentive to our needs. Stay here. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “perfect and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: momo011vancouver
Reviews.Content: stayed here 8 nights, will definitely return. Location excellent, really comfy, good price. Perfect in every way , great value .

Reviews.Title: “We realized what Istanbuls hospitality and local life is”
Reviews.Author: Nikie26
Reviews.Content: We just came back to Finland after a superior week in SultanAhmet,Istanbul. We stayed at Legend Hotel for 7 nights. When we arrived to the hotel we got a a perfect welcoming from the nice hotel stuff members. We got a really nice and clean room with a great oldtown Sultanahmet view. When u travel to this part of the city its obvious to see old buildings from the ancient times. No skyscrapers found:) Location of the hotel is awesome.The tram stop is real close and the supermarket is just outside the hotel. Food you find everywhere. Room service is always there for u, the rooms are cleaned every day really carefully. Breakfast was super nice every morning with a greeeeat view to the sea. I try to think about something bad to say, but I cant. If u visit Legend Hotel you should understand that its an old building with real and traditional style. You will experience the turkish way of living. We all recomend this hotel and will return back as soon as we can:) Thank you all! And greetings from snowy Finland .!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hope to come back :)”
Reviews.Author: GeniaRussia
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for New Year Eve) 8 days of historical and cultural walkings. The hotel is quite near to all historical places - so you can see everything comfortable for you. The staff of the hotel is very intellegent! We enjoyed our time with the Legend! P.S. View from terrace is unforgettable! You can see Bosphorus while having breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Gio and friends”
Reviews.Author: GIO_ITA_GEO_2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for five days. The hotel is very well located in the heart of the European part of Istanbul. The most important historical sites are very close and easy to reach as well as the promenade by the Marmara sea. Also Metro station is five minutes walk. The staff was very warm and kind, Prices are basically good, If you can, make your reservation well in advance, In summary, hotel convenient and simple, suitable for customers who do not have special needs.

Reviews.Title: “very good location”
Reviews.Author: Guenet
Reviews.Content: Reception and the staff were friendly and helpful. The place was perfectly situated on the fringes of the major toursit area of Sultanhamet but close enough to was to the everything. Great cheap local diners on the same street as hotel. It's a safe area with an internet cafe in the basement next door. Across the street from a supermarket with fresh foods and a convenience store just up the street. by the public trasportation tram line.

Reviews.Title: “In need of a facelift but OK”
Reviews.Author: Vladchan
Reviews.Content: The location is brilliant next door to all the main sights. The room furnishings rather tired but not gross. A/c marginal, even after a visit by repairman. Staff friendly but not terribly efficient. Great view from the top floor breakfast terrace, breakfast itself rather Mediterranean - if you are into olives and feta you'll be fine. Overall if you are prepared to go with the flow and not sweat the details, this is not such a bad deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location but in need of a facelift”
Reviews.Author: ruthhuston
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my daughter for three nights in August 2010. The proximity to major atractions is brilliant. Staff were friendly and helpful. Furnishings and fittings were very in need of a make over although beds were new and room was clean. We had a room with a balcony, plenty big enough and overlooking the garden which could be a lovely feature but which appears tatty and neglected. The room lacked a comfortable chair and one of the sliding glass shower doors had come off its roller. These are things that could easily have been put right but had obviously been neglected for a long time. Views from the breakfast room and terrace were magnificent both during the day and night. It was unfortunate that the decor on the walls of the garden and the roof top bar (which didn't seem to be in use) had been entrusted to someone who thought the graffiti art of the 70s and 80s would enhance these areas! A note of caution - breakfast on the roof terrace is very desirable, unfortunately the seagulls thinks so to, a rather malevolent gull eyed us up then dive bombed our table scattering breakfast all over the place and flying off with a slice of water melon - much safer to eat in the breakfast room, still the same splendid views but rather hot.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely,friendly hotel in an excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: dissapointed4
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a wide variety of hotels in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul, so are well placed to compare them. We found Legend Hotel to be a home away from home. The staff were lovely, very friendly and helpful and the hotel had a relaxed, comfortable ambiance. As we had a small child with us we were thoughtfully given a downstairs room with plenty of space. The room was kept in good order by the maid service with clean sheets and towels as needed. The staff were excellent in their care of the safety and well-being of the child. The daytime staff led by Ibrahim being particularly nice. There is an attractive view of the sea and shipping from the breakfast room whilst downstairs is a garden area with seating and an internet cafe where Joseph will give you a warm welcome. The hotel location is ideal, being within very easy walking distance of all the major attractions Hippodrome,Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc. There is a small supermarket opposite and a telephone shop next door as well as good and very reasonably priced local restaurants in the street. This hotel would definitly be our choice for another stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, excellent breakfast, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Raincoast7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Legend Twice during a recent visit to Istanbul and stayed in two different rooms. The first had a balcony overlooking the Marmara Sea and the garden below. The second was a bit larger and faced the street. In both, windows open wide so you don't need to rely on AC. Rooms are clean, comfortable. They are small, but we didn't spend much time there anyway. Location was perfect - just a short stroll to the Cemberlitas tramway and a couple minutes walk to the Blue Mosque and other major attractions. Breakfast in the upstairs dining room was great (excellent views) and we often brought our food to the rooftop deck above, which has sea views and a view of the Blue Mosque. The locale is great, and sometimes it was really quiet, and other days, it was really noisy... I would stay here again as it was great value for the money and suited us well.

Reviews.Title: “Position,position position,clean,friendly,accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: coach75
Reviews.Content: We had not booked. we were held up in the 'volcano' episode,only arriving in Istanbut @ 4am. we asked for a CLEAN hotel in the old city,which we got. Legends is perfect for the business/holiday traveller. Staff,Hakan in particular,directing us to 'value for money' tours.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great staff.”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location and you can easily access the Grand Bazaar, Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia from here on foot. Plenty of restaurants in the vicinity and couldn't have found a hotel in a better place. The staff are very friendly and very courteous. The room was of an average size, not much room to move around and the bathroom on the small side too. The rooms were kept clean at all times and we were provided with extra pillows upon asking for them. The cleaning staff were very nice and friendly. Never lost a thing in the hotel and felt very safe being there. Breakfast was really good and all the other guests seemed to be very friendly and nice as well. The whole atmosphere of the hotel was a family one and seemed like all the employees were either from the same family or at least had that harmony between them. Not a posh hotel, nothing too fancy but it is where I felt safe and relaxed. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It is like visiting family”
Reviews.Author: nametours
Reviews.Content: We can highly recommend the Legend Hotel to any visitor. Hakan Gul and his staff are very friendly and helpfull. Rooms are clean and the breakfast very tasty with a beautiful view. This hotel is also walking distance from the tourist attractions and the metro. Next year we will visit the hotel for the 7th time..as I said it is like visiting family!! All the friends from South Africa

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful base in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Teacher58Uae
Reviews.Content: Our bedroom was warm, with plenty of bedding. We had been worried as the snow was still lying on the ground in Turkey and we had travelled from Dubai! The dining room offers great views of the shipping and the Blue Mosque. It was much too cold to access the rooftop area but I imagine it is a winderful place in summer. The staff were very friendly, polite and helpful. There are many tourist venues within a short walk of this hotel and some great eating places. The bathrooms were all being upgraded and the nosie was kept to a minimum which we appreciate. A great place to stay and I would be happy to return. Am recommending it to friends and colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place - great location”
Reviews.Author: someguyinlebanon
Reviews.Content: couldn't recommend the legend more - the hotel was booked by a corporate travel agent so i wasn't sure what to expect, but i found the legend hotel to be a perfect setting for a stop-over in sultanahmet. wish i'd been there in summer to really take advantage of the roof top terrace

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value with friendly courteous staff”
Reviews.Author: DriveGuy
Reviews.Content: I found that the hotel was very reasonably priced, they were willing to provide a discount as this was not peak season and that they were friendly, courteous and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Room, view, service all first class”
Reviews.Author: Dimaryem
Reviews.Content: We moved to the Legend from another 'hotel' (more like a nightmare) not far away. Our first encounter was with Hakan whose gentle manner and quiet efficiency, as well as his assistance and suggestions made for a very comfortable stay in Istanbul. The other staff were also helpful and efficient. The hotel is clean and ours was a large room, with balcony. The stunning views of the Marmarra and Bospherous were a bonus. Breakfast was standard Turkish but well presented, fresh and plentiful. This centrally located hotel is recommended to those wanting a reasonably priced hotel, that's clean and offers receptive and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “friendliest in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: masoud55
Reviews.Content: The staff at legend made my trip the best stay i have had in istanbu. this was my sixth time in the city and the first at Legend i would definately recomend it and will come back. Hakan, the manager is the best. You can count on him for everything. Masoud and Joel Vancouver, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Best Trip”
Reviews.Author: MuhammadAli96
Reviews.Content: Simply the best hotel to live in Turkey. Economical and good

Reviews.Title: “steer clear of the legend!”
Reviews.Author: slippy333
Reviews.Content: Am actually sat in one of their postage stamp sized rooms writing this now. I know it is a boutique hotel and not supposed to be a real hotel, but am leaving in the morning and will try and find something else more tolerable. staff are friendly enough but they dont have much to work with. its old , tatty, and definitely seen better days. The breakfast terrace is on the roof like most places in istanbul but about 4 meters by 3. its okay for back packers or fugitives. I wish I could post a pic of my room, the aircon cable has three bits of tape covering bare wires. give it a skip

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: CultureCuri0us
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Legend Hotel in Istanbul during our recent visit to Turkey. It is situated in the Sultanahmet area, very central and near to the Blue mosque and Aya Sofia. It is also near the Grand Bazaar, and within walking distance from the Cemberlitas Metro station. They offer a very decent khavalte (breakfast) on their terrace, from where you have a beautiful view over the sea and harbour. Hakan, one of the staff members was very helpful in all areas. It was a pleasure meeting people like him in a country where most do not speak English. There are also other hotels in the area, but I doubt whether they offer the same value for money. I will definitely stay over here again.

Reviews.Title: “For my student group this is the place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Holyfire
Reviews.Content: I am a faculty with the University of Colorado and I've been conducting a study abroad program each year since 200. Finding a reasonable hotel on the historic peninsula of Istanbul for a group of 15 or so has been a challenge till I've found Legend. With different groups I stayed there for a week in May in 2005, and 2006,2007,2008. Good location, reasonable price, but above all, a friendly crew ready to go out of their way to help you, an aspect I value dearly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: DandHVancouverUSA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Legend Hotel for a total of 6 days. The Staff is amazingly attentive, professional, and efficient. Hakan was especially helpful and and kind. By the time we left, he felt like a friend to us. The room was clean and tastefully decorated and we had a fantastic view of the Marmara sea. The hotel's proximity to Topkapi Palace, Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Art museum, Cistern, etc was perfect! We were able to walk to everything. We will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “worthless hotel”
Reviews.Author: theblue0ne
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in this hotel in December and this hotel certainly is a big NO. Was able to have only one hour of sleep. if hygene is important to you, you will be so disappointed with this hotel. The bathroom was not cleaned properly, there was a heavy smell in the room. The bed was not comfortable at all. I was so happy as soon as I checked out from this hotel the next day and went to another one. To be honest, I have nothing positive to tell about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Faulty Towers”
Reviews.Author: dbhBristol_England
Reviews.Content: The picture of the exterior has been airbrushed. Only a small doorway is visible from outside giving it a seedy appearance, and making it difficult to find even for local Taxi drivers!! Location is excellent, but thats all. No hot water for 4 days. Shower tray blocked so overflows all over floor. Handed in our key, reception lost it !! 6 tables only in dining room so you wait in a queue for somewhere to eat breakfast. Got moved after 3 days as the room was needed for 3 people. New room curtains were hanging from the window and would not close. I have never complained about a hotel and have stayed all over the world, but this one is not as described on the tin. It is a hostel and not a hotel. If you are looking for location and friendly, stay here. Anything more, try the YMCA. We are not a bunch of kids but are 2 couples in our late 40's. Both couples had the same problems and we nicknamed the Legend, Faulty Towers. Istanbul is a wonderful vibrant city thoroughly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “location”
Reviews.Author: magyarkiz
Reviews.Content: for location you cannot fault it... the shower was a squeeze and cheap bendy plastic which leaked over the whole bathroom but the rest of the room was fine - we did not have a view but we went out for that. the reception area was promising was sweetly grand - it is a narrow ottoman building- the thing that i would do if i were the owner - whom we met and who was very gracious and laid back, would be to kick my lazy staff into touch. it has so much potential and is so run down. i don't know how the reviews differ so much and i'd hoped the negative ones just reflected those travellers, but no. the garden could be lovely but when i was there from the 19-22 sept the garden was an unloved storage area- disgarded bbq, messy tables unkempt garden- its annoying as there were staff members just lounging about (being paid-for what?) the terrace bar was the same, a mish mash of tables not laid out and not open for drinks ( stairs only for the brave or those related to mountain goats) - yes you can see the Blue Mosque but just the rooves of scruffy buildings apart from that - the breakfast only restaurant had better views but on;y 5 tables and staff you had to search for ( this is NOT Turkish service) the eggs were the most horrific i have ever eaten - whole not actually off they had the taste of stale chalk - the memory still turns my stomach - no turkish tea - liptons and instant chicory coffee - it doesn't cost much to put out some edible food - as always bread was superb. we had to tell the owner about the dripping taps as cleaner obviously hadn't and he showed his keeness buy calling an engineer immediately. location is superb can't be faulted even for the mobilty impaired as the tram service is great and all the main sights in sultanahmet are close by. a recommended city to visit great restaurants along the Divan Yollu to try

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. But great time”
Reviews.Author: niculees
Reviews.Content: good hotel but a few problems. Great view from top of the balcony. Nice back garden and really good location in the old town. The rooms aren't special but they're nothing bad to go by. I had to change my room the 1st night cos there wasn't a city view in a king size room. It was more like a street view in a cubby hole. Fresh sheets everyday and the staff were freindly. There is an internet cafe underneath the hotel which is a bonus. There is no safe in the room but there is in the lobby. Some advice. Get a room overlooking the garden. Quieter and better as there is no city view. There were a few loud conversations/ arguments I could hear in the morning coming from downstairs which was annoying. The rooms don't all come equipped as written on the itinerary. There are 2 men in the lobby all the time at night but this is for security reasons and they're always up for a chat and getting you a drink from the bar or a free turkish tea if you ask them or to lend you a game of backgammon (I had never learnt how to play before and when I was taught I really enjoyed it while smoking a shisha, try it!) anywat the 2 lads at reception were really cool, It depends if you want the bar to yourself or if you're up for getting to know some Turks and engaging in some interesting conversation. Would probably try somewhere else next time as this hotel was nothing special and once you have done the old town, it's good to go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “not like the servie”
Reviews.Author: Jim1978
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 months in advance but there was no room when we arrived there.They moved us to a 2 star hotel for the 1st night and moved back to Legend next day.The room was smelling really bad even we booked a non-smoking room. We always wanted to have something to drink in the lobby but always there 2 men playing back gammon and smoking no not enough room for the guest and they are screaming at 10.00 in the morning. You can see the receptionist with a cigarette on his hand all the time.And there is no bar on the roof. Just the tables and no service at all You have to make your own coffe for breakfast because there is no machine for coffee.The view is very nice but the hotel and staff look like they are fed up with the tourist and want be free in the hotel all the time. I will never choose or tell anyone something good about this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great Location But !!”
Reviews.Author: Terrytri
Reviews.Content: If the location of your hotel is important for your stay in Istanbul. then the Legend is the place for you. At the botton of the street is the old Roman Hippodrome and just a few minutes walk further and you are at the Blue Mosque, opposite is St.Sophia and a few steps further the Topkapi Palace, all right on your doorstep. As for the Legend. It is cheap and that is what you get. Our room whilst clean (fresh sheets every day and a well kept bathroom) was a bit tardy and well worn. The breakfast was adequate. The staff were very good. Most helpful and polite. We arranged a transfer from the airport through the Legend and that was excellent both ways and a bargain at 20 euros each way. Would I use this hotel again? yes. If I were staying just a few nights and wanted to be in the heart of the old town. It's just so convienient for the sights and plenty of restraurants too. What we saved on the Legend we spent eating. For an unusual and romantic meal try the Sarnic Restraurant on Sogukcesme close to the Topkapi Palace, not easy to find. A converted Roman Cistern lit by candle light. Excellent food, good service. Expect to pay English prices.

Reviews.Title: “Double booked but fine ... eventually”
Reviews.Author: rdella
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the hotel was double booked and we were put in a hotel down the road overnight which was awful. The Legend is quite pleasant and the staff are very helpful and accomodating. Location is very good - and the views from the roof very good !

Reviews.Title: “Did NOT honor reservation”
Reviews.Author: tryitout
Reviews.Content: One of the more difficult experiences in a life-time of travel. Made a reservation over a month before our trip and confirmed it a week before arrival, but when we arrived they did not a have a room and moved us to another hotel in the sleaziest neighborhood--a really scarey scene for a seasoned New Yorker and mid-east frequent traveller. After complaining they moved us again (sigh) to a nicer area but not where we wanted to be. I never saw a room at the Legend. Can't say what the place is like. They said their reservation dept. overbooked. We made the best of it--loved Istanbul inspite of the Legend's legendary error!

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Flaming0
Reviews.Content: Really shabby. Smells of cigarettes. Rooms on the front are extremely noisy. I can see that in summer, with the roof terrrace, it will have more to offer but there are better choices.

Reviews.Title: “Budget hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SamThompson
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel largely on the basis of reviews that other travellers had posted. It is located in a side street not far from some of the cities leading attractions. The staff were helpful and offered us a choice of three rooms, which was unexpected, but welcome all the same. Our room smelt of tobacco smoke, which I imagine is a common experience in Turkey, as non-smoking areas, etc do not seem to be common there. The room had a comfortable bed, a small fridge/mini bar and a view of the roof of the Blue Mosque, which was illuminated at night. I had to struggle a little with the curtains to get them to fully cover the window, but the room was clean and the bathroom was adequate. Beware though, the street outside is quite noisy, businesses open early, machines clean the pavements and take away garbage in the middle of the night and mosques call the faithful to prayer by loudspeaker (there is a mosque about 50m down the street). We were delighted though by how close the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia were and in the morning the view over the Sea of Marmara was quite spectacular from the dining room. The breakfast was basic but adequate Turkish fare, cucumbers, bread, cheeses, tomatoes, olives and so on. The hotel has a small bar although I think one is open on the rooftop in the summer time, which would be lovely given the views, but as our trip was in mid winter that was not an option. Overall, the rooms could do with a little money spent on them. Ours had a wardrobe but little else to keep clothing in and we were actually locked in the room at one stage when the door lock jammed. The hotel staff though came at once and the lock was fixed upon out return later that evening. I am not sure if I would stay again. The positives are the location, in the heart of the tourist district, the views and the staff who are helpful. On the down side the location can be a little noisy and some aspects of the rooms are in need of investment. If you are on a budget by all means stay there for a few days, if you can afford to go up market a little you may be better with a but more luxury even if your view is not quite so good.

HotelInfo.Name: Legend Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Peykhane Caddesi No 16 | Sultanahmet, Istanbul 34400 , Turkey
